DOC.brief_summary: In literature , effect acute oxygen administration exercise tolerance relate symptom often appear contradictory . Some investigation report benefit acute oxygen supply exertion , include increased exercise performance , reduce dyspnea , good cardiorespiratory adaptation , whereas study report improvement . Recently , advance hypothesis patient would non-responders even worsen oxygen treatment . The preliminary result confirm hypothesis since demonstrate 56 % patient improved supplemental oxygen , 16 % non-responders 28 % negative-responders ( decreased performance increase dyspnea endurance exercise supplemental oxygen ) . However , pilot study offer preliminary insight tentative conclusion must confirm large case series . The aim retrospective study : 1 . To confirm cohorte clinical test ( 6-minute walk test - 6WT ) deleterious response acute oxygen supplementation LTOT ( long terme oxygenotherapy treatment ) non-LTOT patient exhibit exercise desaturation . 2 . To identify predictive factor among clinical data ( i.e. , anthropometric , spirometric gazometric data ) and/or functional data record rehabilitation program
DOC.brief_title: Correction Exercise-induced Desaturation Acute Oxygen Supply Exercise Responses COPD
DOC.detailed_description: During study , retrospective data collection carry use information contain medical folder patient admit center pulmonary rehabiliation program . We select patient meet follow criterion : A ) patient two 6WT early program B ) desaturate ( SpO2 < 90 % 3 consecutive min ) first 6WT properly correct supply oxygen second walk test . The analyzed parameter distance dyspnea test
DOC.criteria: Obstructive airflow limitation define FEV1/CVF < 70 % FEV1 < 80 % Patients without long terme oxygenotherapy Patients exhibit first test , exerciseinduced desaturation , define SaO2 < 90 % 3 consecutive minute 6minute walk test air condition nonLTOT flow normally recommended exercise LTOT patient ( i.e. , flow rate rest + 1L/min ) Patients desaturation test oxygen supply
